cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.simulatedannealing
Class SimulatedAnnealing

java.lang.Object
  cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.BaseAlgorithm
      cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.simulatedannealing.SimulatedAnnealing
All Implemented Interfaces:
Algorithm, ChainAlgorithm
public class SimulatedAnnealing
extends BaseAlgorithm
implements ChainAlgorithm

Simulated annealing algorithm.

This algorithm is created with starting temperature and anneal coefficient. In every step of init(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.ObjectiveProblem), algorithm performs one randomly selected operation on active configuration. New configuration is accepted as active iff new configuration is better than current active or it passes

e-ΔD/T > Random(0.0, 0.1)

equation, where ΔD is difference of normalized fitnesses of active configuration and new configuration, and T is temperature.

Every step temperature is lowered by anneal coefficient, eg. temperature = temperature * anneal.

Method Detail

init

public void init(ObjectiveProblem problem)
          throws InvalidProblemException
Description copied from interface: Algorithm
Initializes new Algorithm on a problem.

Algorithm is expected to prepare its fitness at this point, since solver can override it afterwards.

Also, keep in mind that one algorithm could be used repeatedly on several different problems, so init should reset all local settings.

Specified by:
init in interface Algorithm
Parameters:
problem - problem to be initialized on
Throws:
InvalidProblemException - if supplied problem cannot be solved by this algorithm
